abstract: Alice Goffman, sociologist whose acclaimed book On the Run: Fugitive Life in an American City explores lives of low-income black men, has been criticized for some facts and methods she employed during six years of immersive fieldwork; some critics say she used her white privilege to access minority communities, while others charge she may have committed felony by helping group of young men seek out their friend's murderer.
lead_paragraph: Since her book “On the Run” was published, the author has achieved a measure of fame that is rare​ for a young sociologist, but ​she now faces criticism over her facts and methods.

headline.main: Alice Goffman’s Heralded Book on Crime Is Disputed
